alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 4:34PM MST until August 21 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 431 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of creeks and normally dry washes and beaches along the Colorado River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cape Royal, Bright Angel Creek and surrounding areas within the Grand Canyon and Grand Canyon National Park. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River, Clear Creek, Bright Angel Creek, and Unkar Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
